254.name: NewSubfileType
254.source: A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile.

255.name: SubfileType
255.source: A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile.

256.name: ImageWidth
256.source: The number of columns in the image, i.e., the number of pixels per row.

257.name: ImageLength
257.source: The number of rows of pixels in the image.

259.name: Compression
259.source: Compression scheme used on the image data.

262.name: PhotometricInterpretation
262.source: The color space of the image data.

263.name: Threshholding
263.source: For black and white TIFF files that represent shades of gray, the technique used to convert from gray to black and white pixels.

264.name: CellWidth
264.source: The width of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file.

265.name: CellLength
265.source: The length of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file.

266.name: FillOrder
266.source: The logical order of bits within a byte.

269.name: DocumentName
269.source: The name of the document from which this image was scanned.

270.name: ImageDescription
270.source: A string that describes the subject of the image.

272.name: Model
272.source: The scanner model name or number.

273.name: StripOffsets
273.source: For each strip, the byte offset of that strip.

274.name: Orientation
274.source: The orientation of the image with respect to the rows and columns.

277.name: SamplesPerPixel
277.source: The number of components per pixel.

278.name: RowsPerStrip
278.source: The number of rows per strip.

279.name: StripByteCounts
279.source: For each strip, the number of bytes in the strip after compression.

282.name: XResolution
282.source: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageWidth direction.

283.name: YResolution
283.source: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageLength direction.

284.name: PlanarConfiguration
284.source: How the components of each pixel are stored.

285.name: PageName
285.source: The name of the page from which this image was scanned.

288.name: FreeOffsets
288.source: For each string of contiguous unused bytes in a TIFF file, the byte offset of the string.

289.name: FreeByteCounts
289.source: For each string of contiguous unused bytes in a TIFF file, the number of bytes in the string.

290.name: GrayResponseUnit
290.source: The precision of the information contained in the GrayResponseCurve.

291.name: GrayResponseCurve
291.source: For grayscale data, the optical density of each possible pixel value.

296.name: ResolutionUnit
296.source: The unit of measurement for XResolution and YResolution.

297.name: PageNumber
297.source: The page number of the page from which this image was scanned.

301.name: TransferFunction
301.source: Describes a transfer function for the image in tabular style.

305.name: Software
305.source: Name and version number of the software package(s) used to create the image.

306.name: DateTime
306.source: Date and time of image creation.

316.name: HostComputer
316.source: The computer and/or operating system in use at the time of image creation.

317.name: Predictor
317.source: A mathematical operator that is applied to the image data before an encoding scheme is applied.

318.name: WhitePoint
318.source: The chromaticity of the white point of the image.

319.name: PrimaryChromaticities
319.source: The chromaticities of the primaries of the image.

320.name: ColorMap
320.source: A color map for palette color images.

321.name: HalftoneHints
321.source: Conveys to the halftone function the range of gray levels within a colorimetrically-specified image that should retain tonal detail.

322.name: TileWidth
322.source: The tile width in pixels. This is the number of columns in each tile.

323.name: TileLength
323.source: The tile length (height) in pixels. This is the number of rows in each tile.

324.name: TileOffsets
324.source: For each tile, the byte offset of that tile, as compressed and stored on disk.

325.name: TileByteCounts
325.source: For each tile, the number of (compressed) bytes in that tile.

326.name: BadFaxLines
326.source: Used in the TIFF-F standard, denotes the number of 'bad' scan lines encountered by the facsimile device.

327.name: CleanFaxData
327.source: Used in the TIFF-F standard, indicates if 'bad' lines encountered during reception are stored in the data, or if 'bad' lines have been replaced by the receiver.

328.name: ConsecutiveBadFaxLines
328.source: Used in the TIFF-F standard, denotes the maximum number of consecutive 'bad' scanlines received.

332.name: InkSet
332.source: The set of inks used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image.

333.name: InkNames
333.source: The name of each ink used in a separated image.

336.name: DotRange
336.source: The component values that correspond to a 0% dot and 100% dot.

337.name: TargetPrinter
337.source: A description of the printing environment for which this separation is intended.

339.name: SampleFormat
339.source: Specifies how to interpret each data sample in a pixel.

342.name: TransferRange
342.source: Expands the range of the TransferFunction.

343.name: ClipPath
343.source: Mirrors the essentials of PostScript's path creation functionality.

344.name: XClipPathUnits
344.source: The number of units that span the width of the image, in terms of integer ClipPath coordinates.

345.name: YClipPathUnits
345.source: The number of units that span the height of the image, in terms of integer ClipPath coordinates.

346.name: Indexed
346.source: Aims to broaden the support for indexed images to include support for any color space.

400.name: GlobalParametersIFD
400.source: Used in the TIFF-FX standard to point to an IFD containing tags that are globally applicable to the complete TIFF file.

401.name: ProfileType
401.source: Used in the TIFF-FX standard, denotes the type of data stored in this file or IFD.

402.name: FaxProfile
402.source: Used in the TIFF-FX standard, denotes the 'profile' that applies to this file.

403.name: CodingMethods
403.source: Used in the TIFF-FX standard, indicates which coding methods are used in the file.

404.name: VersionYear
404.source: Used in the TIFF-FX standard, denotes the year of the standard specified by the FaxProfile field.

405.name: ModeNumber
405.source: Used in the TIFF-FX standard, denotes the mode of the standard specified by the FaxProfile field.

433.name: Decode
433.source: Used in the TIFF-F and TIFF-FX standards, holds information about the ITULAB (PhotometricInterpretation = 10) encoding.

434.name: DefaultImageColor
434.source: Defined in the Mixed Raster Content part of RFC 2301, is the default color needed in areas where no image is available.

512.name: JPEGProc
512.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

513.name: JPEGInterchangeFormat
513.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

514.name: JPEGInterchangeFormatLength
514.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

515.name: JPEGRestartInterval
515.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

517.name: JPEGLosslessPredictors
517.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

518.name: JPEGPointTransforms
518.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

519.name: JPEGQTables
519.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

520.name: JPEGDCTables
520.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

521.name: JPEGACTables
521.source: Old-style JPEG compression field. TechNote2 invalidates this part of the specification.

529.name: YCbCrCoefficients
529.source: The transformation from RGB to YCbCr image data.

530.name: YCbCrSubSampling
530.source: Specifies the subsampling factors used for the chrominance components of a YCbCr image.

531.name: YCbCrPositioning
531.source: Specifies the positioning of subsampled chrominance components relative to luminance samples.

532.name: ReferenceBlackWhite
532.source: Specifies a pair of headroom and footroom image data values (codes) for each pixel component.

559.name: StripRowCounts
559.source: Defined in the Mixed Raster Content part of RFC 2301, used to replace RowsPerStrip for IFDs with variable-sized strips.

18249.name: Image.RatingPercent
18249.source: Ratings tag used by Windows, value as percent

32932.name: Wang Annotation
32932.source: Annotation data, as used in 'Imaging for Windows'.

33421.name: CFARepeatPatternDim
33421.source: For camera raw files from sensors with CFA overlay.

33422.name: CFAPattern
33422.source: For camera raw files from sensors with CFA overlay.

33423.name: BatteryLevel
33423.source: Encodes camera battery level at time of image capture.

33434.name: ExposureTime
33434.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 38

33437.name: FNumber
33437.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 39

33445.name: MD FileTag
33445.source: Specifies the pixel data format encoding in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format.

33446.name: MD ScalePixel
33446.source: Specifies a scale factor in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format.

33447.name: MD ColorTable
33447.source: Used to specify the conversion from 16bit to 8bit in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format.

33448.name: MD LabName
33448.source: Name of the lab that scanned this file, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format.

33449.name: MD SampleInfo
33449.source: Information about the sample, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format.

33450.name: MD PrepDate
33450.source: Date the sample was prepared, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format.

33451.name: MD PrepTime
33451.source: Time the sample was prepared, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format.

33452.name: MD FileUnits
33452.source: Units for data in this file, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format.

33723.name: IPTC/NAA
33723.source: IPTC-NAA (International Press Telecommunications Council-Newspaper Association of America) metadata.

33920.name: IrasB Transformation Matrix
33920.source: Originally part of Intergraph's GeoTIFF tags, but likely understood by IrasB only.

33922.name: ModelTiepointTag
33922.source: Originally part of Intergraph's GeoTIFF tags, but now used in interchangeable GeoTIFF_1_0 files.

34017.name: ColorSequence
34017.source: Sequence of colors if other than CMYK.

34019.name: RasterPadding
34019.source: Type of raster padding used, if any.

34020.name: BitsPerRunLength
34020.source: Number of bits for short run length encoding.

34021.name: BitsPerExtendedRunLength
34021.source: Number of bits for long run length encoding.

34022.name: ColorTable
34022.source: Color value in a color pallette.

34023.name: ImageColorIndicator
34023.source: Indicates if image (foreground) color or transparency is specified.

34027.name: PixelIntensityRange
34027.source: Specifies data values for 0 percent and 100 percent pixel intensity.

34028.name: TransparencyIndicator
34028.source: Specifies if transparency is used in HC file.

34029.name: ColorCharacterization
34029.source: Specifies ASCII table or other reference per ISO 12641 and ISO 12642.

34030.name: HCUsage
34030.source: Indicates the type of information in an HC file.

34031.name: TrapIndicator
34031.source: Indicates whether or not trapping has been applied to the file.

34032.name: CMYKEquivalent
34032.source: Specifies CMYK equivalent for specific separations.

34665.name: Exif IFD
34665.source: A pointer to the Exif IFD.

34732.name: ImageLayer
34732.source: Defined in the Mixed Raster Content part of RFC 2301, used to denote the particular function of this Image in the mixed raster scheme.

34850.name: ExposureProgram
34850.source: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken.
34850.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 41

34852.name: SpectralSensitivity
34852.source: Indicates the spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used.
34852.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 48

34853.name: GPSInfo
34853.source: A pointer to the Exif-related GPS Info IFD.

34855.name: ISOSpeedRatings
34855.source: Indicates the ISO Speed and ISO Latitude of the camera or input device as specified in ISO 12232.
34855.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 47

34856.name: OECF
34856.source: Indicates the Opto-Electric Conversion Function (OECF) specified in ISO 14524.
34856.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 48

34857.name: Interlace
34857.source: Indicates the field number of multifield images.

34858.name: TimeZoneOffset
34858.source: Encodes time zone of camera clock relative to GMT.

34859.name: SelfTimeMode
34859.source: Number of seconds image capture was delayed from button press.

34864.name: SensitivityType
34864.source: The SensitivityType tag indicates PhotographicSensitivity tag, which one of the parameters of ISO 12232. Although it is an optional tag, it should be recorded when a PhotographicSensitivity tag is recorded. Value = 4, 5, 6, or 7 may be used in case that the values of plural parameters are the same.

34865.name: StandardOutputSensitivity
34865.source: This tag indicates the standard output sensitivity value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

34866.name: RecommendedExposureIndex
34866.source: This tag indicates the recommended exposure index value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

34867.name: ISOSpeed
34867.source: This tag indicates the ISO speed value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

34868.name: ISOSpeedLatitudeyyy
34868.source: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude yyy value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232. However, this tag shall not be recorded without ISOSpeed and ISOSpeedLatitudezzz.

34869.name: ISOSpeedLatitudezzz
34869.source: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude zzz value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232. However, this tag shall not be recorded without ISOSpeed and ISOSpeedLatitudeyyy.

36864.name: ExifVersion
36864.source: The version of the supported Exif standard.

36867.name: DateTimeOriginal
36867.source: The date and time when the original image data was generated.
36867.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 37

36868.name: DateTimeDigitized
36868.source: The date and time when the image was stored as digital data.

37121.name: ComponentsConfiguration
37121.source: Specific to compressed data; specifies the channels and complements PhotometricInterpretation

37122.name: CompressedBitsPerPixel
37122.source: Specific to compressed data; states the compressed bits per pixel.
37122.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 27

37377.name: ShutterSpeedValue
37377.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 39

37378.name: ApertureValue
37378.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 39

37379.name: BrightnessValue
37379.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 40

37380.name: ExposureBiasValue
37380.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 40

37381.name: MaxApertureValue
37381.source: The smallest F number of the lens.
37381.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 40

37382.name: SubjectDistance
37382.source: The distance to the subject, given in meters.
37382.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 44

37383.name: MeteringMode
37383.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 41

37384.name: LightSource
37384.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 46

37385.name: Flash
37385.source: Indicates the status of flash when the image was shot.
37385.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 42

37386.name: FocalLength
37386.source: The actual focal length of the lens, in mm.
37386.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 44

37390.name: FocalPlaneXResolution
37390.source: Number of pixels per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit (37392) in ImageWidth direction for main image.

37391.name: FocalPlaneYResolution
37391.source: Number of pixels per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit (37392) in ImageLength direction for main image.

37392.name: FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
37392.source: Unit of measurement for FocalPlaneXResolution(37390) and FocalPlaneYResolution(37391).

37393.name: ImageNumber
37393.source: Number assigned to an image, e.g., in a chained image burst.

37394.name: SecurityClassification
37394.source: Security classification assigned to the image.

37395.name: ImageHistory
37395.source: Record of what has been done to the image.

37396.name: SubjectLocation
37396.source: Indicates the location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.
37396.notes:
Exif Private IFD

TIFF/EP spec, p. 45

37397.name: ExposureIndex
37397.source: Encodes the camera exposure index setting when image was captured.

37398.name: TIFF/EPStandardID
37398.source: For current spec, tag value equals 1 0 0 0.

37510.name: UserComment
37510.source: Keywords or comments on the image; complements ImageDescription.

37520.name: SubsecTime
37520.source: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTime tag.

37521.name: SubsecTimeOriginal
37521.source: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeOriginal tag.

37522.name: SubsecTimeDigitized
37522.source: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeDigitized tag.

40091.name: XPTitle
40091.source: Title tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

40092.name: XPComment
40092.source: Comment tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

40093.name: XPAuthor
40093.source: Author tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

40094.name: XPKeywords
40094.source: Keywords tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

40095.name: XPSubject
40095.source: Subject tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

40960.name: FlashpixVersion
40960.source: The Flashpix format version supported by a FPXR file.

40961.name: ColorSpace
40961.source: The color space information tag is always recorded as the color space specifier.

40962.name: PixelXDimension
40962.source: Specific to compressed data; the valid width of the meaningful image.

40963.name: PixelYDimension
40963.source: Specific to compressed data; the valid height of the meaningful image.

40964.name: RelatedSoundFile
40964.source: Used to record the name of an audio file related to the image data.

40965.name: Interoperability IFD
40965.source: A pointer to the Exif-related Interoperability IFD.

41483.name: FlashEnergy
41483.source: Indicates the strobe energy at the time the image is captured, as measured in Beam Candle Power Seconds

41484.name: SpatialFrequencyResponse
41484.source: Records the camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the direction of image width, image height, and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233.

41486.name: FocalPlaneXResolution
41486.source: Indicates the number of pixels in the image width (X) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

41487.name: FocalPlaneYResolution
41487.source: Indicates the number of pixels in the image height (Y) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

41488.name: FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
41488.source: Indicates the unit for measuring FocalPlaneXResolution and FocalPlaneYResolution.

41492.name: SubjectLocation
41492.source: Indicates the location of the main subject in the scene.

41493.name: ExposureIndex
41493.source: Indicates the exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the image is captured.

41495.name: SensingMethod
41495.source: Indicates the image sensor type on the camera or input device.

41730.name: CFAPattern
41730.source: Indicates the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used.

41985.name: CustomRendered
41985.source: Indicates the use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output.

41986.name: ExposureMode
41986.source: Indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot.

41987.name: WhiteBalance
41987.source: Indicates the white balance mode set when the image was shot.

41988.name: DigitalZoomRatio
41988.source: Indicates the digital zoom ratio when the image was shot.

41989.name: FocalLengthIn35mmFilm
41989.source: Indicates the equivalent focal length assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm.

41990.name: SceneCaptureType
41990.source: Indicates the type of scene that was shot.

41991.name: GainControl
41991.source: Indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment.

41992.name: Contrast
41992.source: Indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

41993.name: Saturation
41993.source: Indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

41994.name: Sharpness
41994.source: Indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

41995.name: DeviceSettingDescription
41995.source: This tag indicates information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model.

41996.name: SubjectDistanceRange
41996.source: Indicates the distance to the subject.

42016.name: ImageUniqueID
42016.source: Indicates an identifier assigned uniquely to each image.

42032.name: CameraOwnerName
42032.source: Camera owner name as ASCII string.

42033.name: BodySerialNumber
42033.source: Camera body serial number as ASCII string.

42034.name: LensSpecification
42034.source: This tag notes minimum focal length, maximum focal length, minimum F number in the minimum focal length, and minimum F number in the maximum focal length, which are specification information for the lens that was used in photography. When the minimum F number is unknown, the notation is 0/0.

42035.name: LensMake
42035.source: Lens manufacturer name as ASCII string.

42036.name: LensModel
42036.source: Lens model name and number as ASCII string.

42037.name: LensSerialNumber
42037.source: Lens serial number as ASCII string.

42112.name: GDAL_METADATA
42112.source: Used by the GDAL library, holds an XML list of name=value 'metadata' values about the image as a whole, and about specific samples.

42113.name: GDAL_NODATA
42113.source: Used by the GDAL library, contains an ASCII encoded nodata or background pixel value.

48129.name: PixelFormat
48129.source: A 128-bit Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) that identifies the image pixel format.

48130.name: Transformation
48130.source: Specifies the transformation to be applied when decoding the image to present the desired representation.

48131.name: Uncompressed
48131.source: Specifies that image data is uncompressed.

48132.name: ImageType
48132.source: Specifies the image type of each individual frame in a multi-frame file.

48256.name: ImageWidth
48256.source: Specifies the number of columns in the transformed photo, or the number of pixels per scan line.

48257.name: ImageHeight
48257.source: Specifies the number of pixels or scan lines in the transformed photo.

48258.name: WidthResolution
48258.source: Specifies the horizontal resolution of a transformed image expressed in pixels per inch.

48259.name: HeightResolution
48259.source: Specifies the vertical resolution of a transformed image expressed in pixels per inch.

48320.name: ImageOffset
48320.source: Specifies the byte offset pointer to the beginning of the photo data, relative to the beginning of the file.

48321.name: ImageByteCount
48321.source: Specifies the size of the photo in bytes.

48322.name: AlphaOffset
48322.source: Specifies the byte offset pointer the beginning of the planar alpha channel data, relative to the beginning of the file.

48323.name: AlphaByteCount
48323.source: Specifies the size of the alpha channel data in bytes.

48324.name: ImageDataDiscard
48324.source: Signifies the level of data that has been discarded from the image as a result of a compressed domain transcode to reduce the file size.

48325.name: AlphaDataDiscard
48325.source: Signifies the level of data that has been discarded from the planar alpha channel as a result of a compressed domain transcode to reduce the file size.

50215.name: Oce Scanjob Description
50215.source: Used in the Oce scanning process.

50216.name: Oce Application Selector
50216.source: Used in the Oce scanning process.

50217.name: Oce Identification Number
50217.source: Used in the Oce scanning process.

50218.name: Oce ImageLogic Characteristics
50218.source: Used in the Oce scanning process.

50706.name: DNGVersion
50706.source:
Encodes DNG four-tier version number; for version 1.1.0.0, the tag 

            contains the bytes 1, 1, 0, 0. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50707.name: DNGBackwardVersion
50707.source:
Defines oldest version of spec with which file is compatible. Used 

            in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50708.name: UniqueCameraModel
50708.source:
Unique, non-localized nbame for camera model. Used in IFD 0 of DNG 

            files.

50709.name: LocalizedCameraModel
50709.source:
Similar to 50708, with localized camera name. Used in IFD 0 of DNG 

            files.

50710.name: CFAPlaneColor
50710.source:
Mapping between values in the CFAPattern tag and the plane numbers 

            in LinearRaw space. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50711.name: CFALayout
50711.source: Spatial layout of the CFA. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50712.name: LinearizationTable
50712.source:
Lookup table that maps stored values to linear values. Used in Raw 

            IFD of DNG files.

50713.name: BlackLevelRepeatDim
50713.source: Repeat pattern size for BlackLevel tag. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50714.name: BlackLevel
50714.source: Specifies the zero light encoding level.Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50715.name: BlackLevelDeltaH
50715.source:
Specifies the difference between zero light encoding level for each 

            column and the baseline zero light encoding level. Used in Raw IFD 

            of DNG files.

50716.name: BlackLevelDeltaV
50716.source:
Specifies the difference between zero light encoding level for each 

            row and the baseline zero light encoding level. Used in Raw IFD of 

            DNG files.

50717.name: WhiteLevel
50717.source:
Specifies the fully saturated encoding level for the raw sample 

            values. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50718.name: DefaultScale
50718.source:
For cameras with non-square pixels, specifies the default scale 

            factors for each direction to convert the image to square pixels. 

            Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50719.name: DefaultCropOrigin
50719.source:
Specifies the origin of the final image area, ignoring the extra 

            pixels at edges used to prevent interpolation artifacts. Used in Raw 

            IFD of DNG files.

50720.name: DefaultCropSize
50720.source:
Specifies size of final image area in raw image coordinates. Used 

            in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50721.name: ColorMatrix1
50721.source:
Defines a transformation matrix that converts XYZ values to reference 

            camera native color space values, under the first calibration illuminant. 

            Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50722.name: ColorMatrix2
50722.source:
Defines a transformation matrix that converts XYZ values to reference 

            camera native color space values, under the second calibration illuminant. 

            Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50723.name: CameraCalibration1
50723.source:
Defines a calibration matrix that transforms reference camera native 

            space values to individual camera native space values under the first 

            calibration illuminant. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50724.name: CameraCalibration2
50724.source:
Defines a calibration matrix that transforms reference camera native 

            space values to individual camera native space values under the second 

            calibration illuminant. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50725.name: ReductionMatrix1
50725.source:
Defines a dimensionality reduction matrix for use as the first stage 

            in converting color camera native space values to XYZ values, under 

            the first calibration illuminant. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50726.name: ReductionMatrix2
50726.source:
Defines a dimensionality reduction matrix for use as the first stage 

            in converting color camera native space values to XYZ values, under 

            the second calibration illuminant. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50727.name: AnalogBalance
50727.source:
Pertaining to white balance, defines the gain, either analog or 

            digital, that has been applied to the stored raw values. Used in IFD 

            0 of DNG files.

50728.name: AsShotNeutral
50728.source:
Specifies the selected white balance at the time of capture, encoded 

            as the coordinates of a perfectly neutral color in linear reference 

            space values. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50729.name: AsShotWhiteXY
50729.source:
Specifies the selected white balance at the time of capture, encoded 

            as x-y chromaticity coordinates. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50730.name: BaselineExposure
50730.source:
Specifies in EV units how much to move the zero point for exposure 

            compensation. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50731.name: BaselineNoise
50731.source:
Specifies the relative noise of the camera model at a baseline ISO 

            value of 100, compared to reference camera model. Used in IFD 0 of 

            DNG files.

50732.name: BaselineSharpness
50732.source:
Specifies the relative amount of sharpening required for this camera 

            model, compared to reference camera model. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50733.name: BayerGreenSplit
50733.source:
For CFA images, specifies, in arbitrary units, how closely the values 

            of the green pixels in the blue/green rows track the values of the 

            green pixels in the red/green rows. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50734.name: LinearResponseLimit
50734.source:
Specifies the fraction of the encoding range above which the response 

            may become significantly non-linear. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50735.name: CameraSerialNumber
50735.source: Serial number of camera. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50736.name: LensInfo
50736.source: Information about the lens. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50737.name: ChromaBlurRadius
50737.source:
Normally for non-CFA images, provides a hint about how much chroma 

            blur ought to be applied. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50738.name: AntiAliasStrength
50738.source:
Provides a hint about the strength of the camera's anti-aliasing 

            filter. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50739.name: ShadowScale
50739.source:
Used by Adobe Camera Raw to control sensitivity of its shadows slider. 

            Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50740.name: DNGPrivateData
50740.source:
Provides a way for camera manufacturers to store private data in 

            DNG files for use by their own raw convertors. Used in IFD 0 of DNG 

            files.

50741.name: MakerNoteSafety
50741.source:
Lets the DNG reader know whether the Exif MakerNote tag is safe 

            to preserve. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50778.name: CalibrationIlluminant1
50778.source:
Illuminant used for first set of calibration tags. Used in IFD 0 

            of DNG files.

50779.name: CalibrationIlluminant2
50779.source:
Illuminant used for second set of calibration tags. Used in IFD 

            0 of DNG files.

50780.name: BestQualityScale
50780.source:
Specifies the amount by which the values of the DefaultScale tag 

            need to be multiplied to achieve best quality image size. Used in 

            Raw IFD of DNG files.

50781.name: RawDataUniqueID
50781.source:
Contains a 16-byte unique identifier for the raw image file in the 

            DNG file. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50784.name: Alias Layer Metadata
50784.source: Alias Sketchbook Pro layer usage description.

50827.name: OriginalRawFileName
50827.source:
Name of original file if the DNG file results from conversion from 

            a non-DNG raw file. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50828.name: OriginalRawFileData
50828.source:
If the DNG file was converted from a non-DNG raw file, then this 

            tag contains the original raw data. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50829.name: ActiveArea
50829.source:
Defines the active (non-masked) pixels of the sensor. Used in Raw 

            IFD of DNG files.

50830.name: MaskedAreas
50830.source:
List of non-overlapping rectangle coordinates of fully masked pixels, 

            which can optimally be used by DNG readers to measure the black encoding 

            level. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50831.name: AsShotICCProfile
50831.source:
Contains ICC profile that, in conjunction with the AsShotPreProfileMatrix 

            tag, specifies a default color rendering from camera color space coordinates 

            (linear reference values) into the ICC profile connection space. Used 

            in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50832.name: AsShotPreProfileMatrix
50832.source:
Specifies a matrix that should be applied to the camera color space 

            coordinates before processing the values through the ICC profile specified 

            in the AsShotICCProfile tag. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50833.name: CurrentICCProfile
50833.source:
The CurrentICCProfile and CurrentPreProfileMatrix tags have the 

            same purpose and usage as

            the AsShotICCProfile and AsShotPreProfileMatrix tag pair, except they 

            are for use by raw file

            editors rather than camera manufacturers. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50834.name: CurrentPreProfileMatrix
50834.source:
The CurrentICCProfile and CurrentPreProfileMatrix tags have the 

            same purpose and usage as

            the AsShotICCProfile and AsShotPreProfileMatrix tag pair, except they 

            are for use by raw file

            editors rather than camera manufacturers. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50879.name: ColorimetricReference
50879.source: The DNG color model documents a transform between camera colors and CIE XYZ values. This tag describes the colorimetric reference for the CIE XYZ values. 0 = The XYZ values are scene-referred. 1 = The XYZ values are output-referred, using the ICC profile perceptual dynamic range. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50931.name: CameraCalibrationSignature
50931.source: A UTF-8 encoded string associated with the CameraCalibration1 and CameraCalibration2 tags. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50932.name: ProfileCalibrationSignature
50932.source: A UTF-8 encoded string associated with the camera profile tags. Used in IFD 0 or CameraProfile IFD of DNG files.

50933.name: ExtraCameraProfiles
50933.source: A list of file offsets to extra Camera Profile IFDs. The format of a camera profile begins with a 16-bit byte order mark (MM or II) followed by a 16-bit "magic" number equal to 0x4352 (CR), a 32-bit IFD offset, and then a standard TIFF format IFD. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50934.name: AsShotProfileName
50934.source: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the name of the "as shot" camera profile, if any. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50935.name: NoiseReductionApplied
50935.source: Indicates how much noise reduction has been applied to the raw data on a scale of 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 value indicates that no noise reduction has been applied. A 1.0 value indicates that the "ideal" amount of noise reduction has been applied, i.e. that the DNG reader should not apply additional noise reduction by default. A value of 0/0 indicates that this parameter is unknown. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50936.name: ProfileName
50936.source: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the name of the camera profile. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50937.name: ProfileHueSatMapDims
50937.source: Specifies the number of input samples in each dimension of the hue/saturation/value mapping tables. The data for these tables are stored in ProfileHueSatMapData1 and ProfileHueSatMapData2 tags. Allowed values include the following: HueDivisions >= 1; SaturationDivisions >= 2; ValueDivisions >=1. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50938.name: ProfileHueSatMapData1
50938.source: Contains the data for the first hue/saturation/value mapping table. Each entry of the table contains three 32-bit IEEE floating-point values. The first entry is hue shift in degrees; the second entry is saturation scale factor; and the third entry is a value scale factor. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50939.name: ProfileHueSatMapData2
50939.source: Contains the data for the second hue/saturation/value mapping table. Each entry of the table contains three 32-bit IEEE floating-point values. The first entry is hue shift in degrees; the second entry is saturation scale factor; and the third entry is a value scale factor. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50940.name: ProfileToneCurve
50940.source: Contains a default tone curve that can be applied while processing the image as a starting point for user adjustments. The curve is specified as a list of 32-bit IEEE floating-point value pairs in linear gamma. Each sample has an input value in the range of 0.0 to 1.0, and an output value in the range of 0.0 to 1.0. The first sample is required to be (0.0, 0.0), and the last sample is required to be (1.0, 1.0). Interpolated the curve using a cubic spline. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50941.name: ProfileEmbedPolicy
50941.source: Contains information about the usage rules for the associated camera profile. The valid values and meanings are: 0 = allow copying; 1 = embed if used; 2 = embed never; and 3 = no restrictions. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50942.name: ProfileCopyright
50942.source: Contains information about the usage rules for the associated camera profile. The valid values and meanings are: 0 = allow copying; 1 = embed if used; 2 = embed never; and 3 = no restrictions. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50964.name: ForwardMatrix1
50964.source: Defines a matrix that maps white balanced camera colors to XYZ D50 colors. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50965.name: ForwardMatrix2
50965.source: Defines a matrix that maps white balanced camera colors to XYZ D50 colors. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50966.name: PreviewApplicationName
50966.source: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the name of the application that created the preview stored in the IFD. Used in Preview IFD of DNG files.

50967.name: PreviewApplicationVersion
50967.source: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the version number of the application that created the preview stored in the IFD. Used in Preview IFD of DNG files.

50968.name: PreviewSettingsName
50968.source: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the name of the conversion settings (for example, snapshot name) used for the preview stored in the IFD. Used in Preview IFD of DNG files.

50969.name: PreviewSettingsDigest
50969.source: A unique ID of the conversion settings (for example, MD5 digest) used to render the preview stored in the IFD. Used in Preview IFD of DNG files.

50970.name: PreviewColorSpace
50970.source: This tag specifies the color space in which the rendered preview in this IFD is stored. The valid values include: 0 = Unknown; 1 = Gray Gamma 2.2; 2 = sRGB; 3 = Adobe RGB; and 4 = ProPhoto RGB. Used in Preview IFD of DNG files.

50971.name: PreviewDateTime
50971.source: This tag is an ASCII string containing the name of the date/time at which the preview stored in the IFD was rendered, encoded using ISO 8601 format. Used in Preview IFD of DNG files.

50972.name: RawImageDigest
50972.source: MD5 digest of the raw image data. All pixels in the image are processed in row-scan order. Each pixel is zero padded to 16 or 32 bits deep (16-bit for data less than or equal to 16 bits deep, 32-bit otherwise). The data is processed in little-endian byte order. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50973.name: OriginalRawFileDigest
50973.source: MD5 digest of the data stored in the OriginalRawFileData tag. Used in IFD 0 of DNG files.

50974.name: SubTileBlockSize
50974.source: Normally, pixels within a tile are stored in simple row-scan order. This tag specifies that the pixels within a tile should be grouped first into rectangular blocks of the specified size. These blocks are stored in row-scan order. Within each block, the pixels are stored in row-scan order. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50975.name: RowInterleaveFactor
50975.source: Specifies that rows of the image are stored in interleaved order. The value of the tag specifies the number of interleaved fields. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

50981.name: ProfileLookTableDims
50981.source: Specifies the number of input samples in each dimension of a default "look" table. The data for this table is stored in the ProfileLookTableData tag. Allowed values include: HueDivisions >= 1; SaturationDivisions >= 2; and ValueDivisions >= 1. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

50982.name: ProfileLookTableData
50982.source: Default "look" table that can be applied while processing the image as a starting point for user adjustment. This table uses the same format as the tables stored in the ProfileHueSatMapData1 and ProfileHueSatMapData2 tags, and is applied in the same color space. However, it should be applied later in the processing pipe, after any exposure compensation and/or fill light stages, but before any tone curve stage. Each entry of the table contains three 32-bit IEEE floating-point values. The first entry is hue shift in degrees, the second entry is a saturation scale factor, and the third entry is a value scale factor. Used in IFD 0 or Camera Profile IFD of DNG files.

51008.name: OpcodeList1
51008.source: Specifies the list of opcodes (image processing operation codes) that should be applied to the raw image, as read directly from the file. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

51009.name: OpcodeList2
51009.source: Specifies the list of opcodes (image processing operation codes) that should be applied to the raw image, just after it has been mapped to linear reference values. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

51022.name: OpcodeList3
51022.source: Specifies the list of opcodes (image processing operation codes) that should be applied to the raw image, just after it has been demosaiced. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

51041.name: NoiseProfile
51041.source: Describes the amount of noise in a raw image; models the amount of signal-dependent photon (shot) noise and signal-independent sensor readout noise, two common sources of noise in raw images. Used in Raw IFD of DNG files.

51089.name: OriginalDefaultFinalSize
51089.source:
If this file is a proxy for a larger original DNG file, this tag specifics the default final size of the larger original file from which this proxy was generated. The default value for this tag is default final size
of the current DNG file, which is DefaultCropSize * DefaultScale.

51090.name: OriginalBestQualityFinalSize
51090.source: If this file is a proxy for a larger original DNG file, this tag specifics the best quality final size of the larger original file from which this proxy was generated. The default value for this tag is the OriginalDefaultFinalSize, if specified. Otherwise the default value for this tag is the best quality size of the current DNG file, which is DefaultCropSize * DefaultScale * BestQualityScale.

51091.name: OriginalDefaultCropSize
51091.source:
If this file is a proxy for a larger original DNG file, this tag specifics the DefaultCropSize of the larger original file from
which this proxy was generated.  The default value for this tag is the OriginalDefaultFinalSize, if specified. Otherwise, the default value for this tag is the DefaultCropSize of the current DNG file.

51107.name: ProfileHueSatMapEncoding
51107.source: Provides a way for color profiles to specify how indexing into a 3D HueSatMap is performed during raw conversion. This tag is not applicable to 2.5D HueSatMap tables (i.e., where the Value dimension is 1). The currently defined values are: 0 = Linear encoding (method described in DNG spec); 1 = sRGB encoding (method described in DNG spec).

51108.name: ProfileLookTableEncoding
51108.source: Provides a way for color profiles to specify how indexing into a 3D LookTable is performed during raw conversion. This tag is not applicable to a 2.5D LookTable (i.e., where the Value dimension is 1). The currently defined values are: 0 = Linear encoding (method described in DNG spec); 1 = sRGB encoding (method described in DNG spec).

51109.name: BaselineExposureOffset
51109.source:
Provides a way for color profiles to increase
or decrease exposure during raw conversion. BaselineExposureOffset specifies the amount (in
EV units) to add to th
e BaselineExposure tag
during image rendering. For example, if the
BaselineExposure value fo
r a given camera model
is +0.3, and the BaselineExposureOffset value
for a given camera profile used to render an
image for that camera model is -0.7, then th
e actual default exposure value used during
rendering will be +0.3 - 0.7 = -0.4.

51110.name: DefaultBlackRender
51110.source: This optional tag in a color profile provides a hint to the raw converter regarding how to handle the black point (e.g., flare subtraction) during rendering. The currently defined values are: 0 = Auto; 1 = None.  If set to Auto, the raw converter should perform black subtraction during rendering. The amount and method of black subtraction may be automatically determined and may be image-dependent.  If set to None, the raw converter should not perform any black subtraction during rendering.  This may be desirable when using color lookup tables (e.g., LookTable) or tone curves in camera profiles to perform a fixed, consistent level of black subtraction.

51111.name: NewRawImageDigest
51111.source: This tag is a modified MD5 digest of the raw image data. It has been updated from the algorithm used to compute the RawImageDigest tag be more multi-processor friendly, and to support lossy compression algorithms. The details of the algorithm used to compute this tag are documented in the Adobe DNG SDK source code.

51112.name: RawToPreviewGain
51112.source: The gain (what number the sample values are multiplied by) between the main raw IFD and the preview IFD containing this tag.

51125.name: DefaultUserCrop
51125.source: Specifies a default user crop rectangle in relative coordinates.  The values must satisfy: 0.0 <= top < bottom <= 1.0; 0.0 <= left < right <= 1.0.  The default values of (top = 0, left = 0, bottom = 1, right = 1) correspond exactly to the default crop rectangle (as specified by the DefaultCropOrigin and DefaultCropSize tags).
